Description: Body fragment of East Greek pottery open vessel; slipped on exterior; inside reserved. Exterior: feline crouching to right, its left forepaw raised; much of the lower part of the animal preserved; heavy filling ornament, fan- and cross-incised rosettes. Band below and small part of lower frieze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 18, no. 57 pl. 14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.913)
